titles: Britannia languens: or, A discourse of trade shewing, that the present management of trade in England, is the true reason of the decay of our manufactures, and the late great fall of land-rents; and that the increase of trade, in the method it now stands in, must proportionably decay England. Wherein is particularly demonstrated, that the East-India Company, as now managed, has already near destroyed our trade in those parts, as well as that with Turky, and in short time must necessarily beggar the nation. Humbly offered to the consideration of this present Parliament.
author: Petyt, William, 1636-1707.
publisher: printed for Richard Baldwin, near the Black Bull in the Old-Baily,
notes: Attributed by Wing to William Petyt.
With table of contents and errata at end of text.
Text appears continuous despite pagination; quire E consists of 4 leaves.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: East India Company --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  Commercial policy --  Early works to 1800.
